Events that occurred on 22 March.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1916 – J.R.R. Tolkien marries Edith Bratt in the church of St Mary Immaculate in Warwick.
1968 - The Daily Telegraph publishes an interview of Charlotte and Denis Plimmer with J.R.R. Tolkien.
1981 - The third episode of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
1996 - Tyalië Tyelelliéva issue 8 is published.
2006 - Preview performances of The Lord of the Rings (musical) end.
2018 - Pagan Saints in Middle-earth is published.
2019 - Jared Lobdell dies.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 2510:
Borondir is on his way in search of the Éothéod.
T.A. 3019:
The Host of the West marches towards the Black Gate.
Third assault on Lothlórien.
The dreadful nightfall.
Frodo and Sam leave the road and turn south to Mount Doom.
